tables.name: evm_blocks
tables.description: The evm_blocks table contains information about EVM blocks from the Cosmos ecosystem. It provides insights into the block data, such as height, timestamp, hash, and ingestion timestamp.

columns.name: height
columns.description: The height of the block in the blockchain, representing the number of blocks processed up to this point.

columns.name: timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block in the blockchain, indicating when the block was created.

columns.name: hash
columns.description: The unique hash of the block in the blockchain, identifying the block and its transactions.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block data was ingested into the system, indicating when the data became available.

tables.name: evm_logs
tables.description: This table contains logs from the Cosmos EVM, providing insights into the flows of assets within the ecosystem. The data is sourced from blockchains within the Cosmos ecosystem.

columns.name: address
columns.description: The Ethereum address associated with the log, representing the account that triggered or interacted with the event.

columns.name: data
columns.description: The data associated with the log, often representing the parameters or results of an interaction.

columns.name: block_hash
columns.description: The hash of the block that contains the log, providing context for the log's occurrence.

columns.name: log_index
columns.description: The index of the log within the block, indicating its position within the block's transactions.

columns.name: transaction_hash_evm
columns.description: The hash of the EVM transaction that triggered or included the log, linking it to the transaction.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the log was ingested into the database, representing the time of data import.

columns.name: topics
columns.description: The topics associated with the log, often representing categories or parameters of the event.

tables.name: evm_tokens_sales
tables.description: Cosmos EVM Token Sales Data: This table contains information about token sales occurring on the Cosmos EVM network. It provides a detailed record of transactions involving tokens, including the marketplaces and wallets involved.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transaction occurred.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block in which the transaction occurred.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: A unique identifier for the transaction.

columns.name: tx_hash_evm
columns.description: The EVM equivalent of the transaction hash, if applicable.

columns.name: log_index
columns.description: The index of the log entry containing the transaction data.

columns.name: marketplace
columns.description: The marketplace where the token sale occurred.

columns.name: from
columns.description: The wallet address that initiated the token sale.

columns.name: to
columns.description: The wallet address that received the tokens.

columns.name: token_address
columns.description: The address of the token involved in the sale.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the database.

tables.name: evm_transactions
tables.description: This table contains Cosmos ecosystem blockchain transactions that interact with the EVM. It provides information on transaction details, sender, recipient, and gas usage.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transaction was included.

columns.name: hash
columns.description: The unique hash of the transaction.

columns.name: hash_evm
columns.description: The EVM-specific hash of the transaction.

columns.name: evm_index
columns.description: The index of the EVM transaction within the parent transaction.

columns.name: gas_used
columns.description: The amount of gas used by the transaction.

columns.name: amount
columns.description: The amount of tokens transferred in the transaction.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The account address that initiated the transaction.

columns.name: evm_sender
columns.description: The EVM-specific sender address of the transaction.

columns.name: recipient
columns.description: The account address that received the tokens.

columns.name: code
columns.description: The bytecode of the contract deployed or executed during the transaction.

columns.name: data
columns.description: Additional data associated with the transaction.

columns.name: index
columns.description: The index of the transaction within the block.

columns.name: gas_limit
columns.description: The maximum amount of gas allowed for the transaction.

columns.name: tx_json
columns.description: The JSON representation of the transaction.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the transaction was ingested into the system.

columns.name: MsgEthereumTx
columns.description: Additional metadata related to Ethereum transactions.

columns.name: LegacyTx
columns.description: Metadata related to legacy transactions.

columns.name: AccessListTx
columns.description: Metadata related to access list transactions.

columns.name: DynamicFeeTx
columns.description: Metadata related to dynamic fee transactions.

columns.name: raw_data
columns.description: The raw data associated with the transaction.

columns.name: TxRaw
columns.description: The raw transaction data.

columns.name: gas_price
columns.description: The price of gas used by the transaction.

tables.name: evm_transfer_event
tables.description: This table captures transfer events on the Cosmos blockchain, providing insights into token movements across the network. It offers a detailed view of token transactions, including sender and recipient addresses.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transfer event occurred.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block containing the transfer event was mined.

columns.name: tx_hash_evm
columns.description: The Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) transaction hash.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: The Cosmos blockchain transaction hash.

columns.name: log_index
columns.description: The index of the log within the transaction that triggered the transfer event.

columns.name: token_address
columns.description: The address of the token involved in the transfer.

columns.name: from
columns.description: The address from which the token was transferred.

columns.name: to
columns.description: The address to which the token was transferred.

columns.name: amount
columns.description: The quantity of tokens transferred during the event.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the transfer event was ingested into the database.

tables.name: evm_transfer_single_event
tables.description: This table displays details of single event transfers on the Cosmos blockchain ecosystem.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transfer occurred.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block in which the transfer occurred.

columns.name: tx_hash_evm
columns.description: EVM-compliant transaction hash.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: Unique transaction hash.

columns.name: log_index
columns.description: Index of the log entry for the transaction.

columns.name: token_address
columns.description: Address of the token involved in the transfer.

columns.name: operator
columns.description: The operator or entity that facilitated the transfer.

columns.name: from
columns.description: Address that initiated the transfer.

columns.name: to
columns.description: Address that received the transfer.

columns.name: id
columns.description: Unique identifier for the transfer event.

columns.name: amount
columns.description: Amount of the token transferred.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp when the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: evm_uniswap_v2_dex_swaps
tables.description: This table provides a detailed record of all Uniswap V2 decentralized exchange (DEX) swaps that occurred on the Cosmos blockchain ecosystem. The data is sourced from blockchain events and includes relevant transaction information.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transaction occurred.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block in which the transaction occurred.

columns.name: tx_hash_evm
columns.description: The Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) transaction hash associated with the swap.

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: The Cosmos blockchain transaction hash associated with the swap.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address that initiated the swap transaction.

columns.name: evm_sender
columns.description: The EVM sender address associated with the swap.

columns.name: log_index
columns.description: The index of the log associated with the swap event.

columns.name: pair
columns.description: The Uniswap V2 pair involved in the swap.

columns.name: dex_router
columns.description: The router used for the Uniswap V2 swap.

columns.name: to
columns.description: The recipient address of the swap transaction.

columns.name: amount_0_in
columns.description: The amount of token 0 transferred into the swap.

columns.name: amount_1_in
columns.description: The amount of token 1 transferred into the swap.

columns.name: amount_0_out
columns.description: The amount of token 0 transferred out of the swap.

columns.name: amount_1_out
columns.description: The amount of token 1 transferred out of the swap.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the database.

tables.name: evmos_blocks
tables.description: This table contains information about blocks in the Cosmos blockchain ecosystem, providing insights into block heights, timestamps, and other relevant metrics.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in the blockchain, indicating its position in the chain.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block was created, measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: chain_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for the Cosmos blockchain network, distinguishing it from other networks.

columns.name: proposer_address
columns.description: The address of the validator that proposed the block for inclusion in the blockchain.

columns.name: validators_hash
columns.description: A hash of the validators that participated in the block's validation process.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block data was ingested into the system, measured in seconds since the Unix epoch.

columns.name: messages_bytes
columns.description: The total number of bytes in all the messages (transactions) included in the block.

columns.name: tx_count
columns.description: The total number of transactions (messages) included in the block.

tables.name: evmos_convert_ERC20
tables.description: This table contains information about ERC20 token conversions on the Cosmos network, providing insights into the flow of tokens between different users and addresses.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block on the Cosmos blockchain where the conversion occurred.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block on the Cosmos blockchain where the conversion occurred.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the transaction on the Cosmos blockchain where the conversion occurred.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message in the transaction on the Cosmos blockchain where the conversion occurred.

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: The action number of the message in the transaction on the Cosmos blockchain where the conversion occurred.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the sender who initiated the token conversion on the Cosmos blockchain.

columns.name: receiver
columns.description: The address of the receiver who received the converted tokens on the Cosmos blockchain.

columns.name: amount
columns.description: The amount of tokens converted in the transaction on the Cosmos blockchain.

columns.name: erc20_token
columns.description: The ERC20 token that was converted in the transaction on the Cosmos blockchain.

columns.name: cosmos_coin
columns.description: The Cosmos coin that the ERC20 token was converted to.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: evmos_convert_coin
tables.description: This table contains transaction data from the Cosmos blockchain ecosystem, providing insights into the flow of coins and tokens across the network. It offers a comprehensive view of transactions, including sender and receiver information.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in the blockchain, indicating the position of the transaction in the chain.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block was created, marking the time of the transaction.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for the transaction, allowing for easy tracking and reference.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message in the transaction, helping to distinguish between multiple actions within a single transaction.

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: A counter indicating the order of actions within a transaction, providing additional context to the transaction flow.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address or account that initiated the transaction, sending coins or tokens to the receiver.

columns.name: receiver
columns.description: The address or account that received the transaction, accepting coins or tokens from the sender.

columns.name: amount
columns.description: The quantity of coins or tokens transferred as part of the transaction, reflecting the transaction's value.

columns.name: cosmos_coin
columns.description: The type of Cosmos coin involved in the transaction, such as ATOM or other native tokens.

columns.name: erc20_token
columns.description: The type of ERC20 token involved in the transaction, allowing for the tracking of specific tokens.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the transaction data was ingested into the system, marking the time of data processing.

tables.name: evmos_delegate
tables.description: This table provides a comprehensive view of transactions and actions within the Cosmos ecosystem, including block height, timestamps, and token-related activities.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The current height of the block in the blockchain.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block was created.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction.

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: validator
columns.description: The validator responsible for processing the transaction.

columns.name: moniker
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: delegator
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: parsed_EVMOS_amount
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: new_shares
columns.description: The newly minted or exchanged shares.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: evmos_developer_revenue
tables.description: This dataset contains revenue information for developers from various blockchains within the Cosmos ecosystem. It provides insight into the financial activity of developers in the Cosmos network.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block at which the transaction was recorded.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the block was created.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for the transaction.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction.

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: The position of the action within the message.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the sender of the transaction.

columns.name: amount
columns.description: The amount of the transaction in the native coin of the blockchain.

columns.name: amount_in_usdc
columns.description: The amount of the transaction in USDC (a stablecoin).

columns.name: contract
columns.description: The contract address involved in the transaction.

columns.name: withdraw_address
columns.description: The address to which the funds were withdrawn.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the data was ingested into the dataset.

tables.name: evmos_event_attributes
tables.description: This table provides information about blockchain events from the Cosmos ecosystem, including metadata and attribute values. It is useful for analyzing and understanding event data in the Cosmos network.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in the blockchain

columns.name: chain_id
columns.description: The ID of the blockchain

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: The ID of the transaction

columns.name: event_index
columns.description: The index of the event within the transaction

columns.name: event_type
columns.description: The type of the event

columns.name: event_source
columns.description: The source of the event

columns.name: attribute_key
columns.description: The key of the attribute value

columns.name: attribute_value
columns.description: The value of the attribute

columns.name: attribute_index
columns.description: The index of the attribute within the event

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block was created

tables.name: evmos_ibc_receive
tables.description: This table contains information about IBC receive packets in the Cosmos ecosystem, capturing key details about the packets and the transactions that involve them. The data provides insights into the inter-blockchain communication and token transfer processes within the ecosystem.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the IBC receive packet was processed.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block in which the IBC receive packet was processed.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the transaction that contains the IBC receive packet.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction that contains the IBC receive packet.

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: The action within the message that contains the IBC receive packet.

columns.name: packet_src_channel
columns.description: The source channel of the IBC receive packet.

columns.name: packet_dts_channel
columns.description: The destination channel of the IBC receive packet.

columns.name: packet_connection
columns.description: The connection of the IBC receive packet.

columns.name: packet_sequence
columns.description: The sequence of the IBC receive packet.

columns.name: packet_ack
columns.description: The acknowledgement of the IBC receive packet.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The account address that sent the IBC receive packet.

columns.name: receiver
columns.description: The account address that received the IBC receive packet.

columns.name: token_amount
columns.description: The amount of tokens transferred through the IBC receive packet.

columns.name: token_path
columns.description: The path of the tokens transferred through the IBC receive packet.

columns.name: token_alias
columns.description: The alias of the tokens transferred through the IBC receive packet.

columns.name: token_denom
columns.description: The denomination of the tokens transferred through the IBC receive packet.

columns.name: memo
columns.description: Any memo associated with the IBC receive packet.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: evmos_ibc_transfer
tables.description: This table contains information about IBC (Inter-Blockchain Communication) token transfers within the Cosmos ecosystem. It provides insights into token movements between different blockchain networks and channels.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the IBC transfer was recorded.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the block containing the IBC transfer was mined.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the transaction containing the IBC transfer.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction that contains the IBC transfer.

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: The action index of the IBC transfer within the message.

columns.name: packet_src_channel
columns.description: The source channel identifier of the IBC packet.

columns.name: packet_dts_channel
columns.description: The destination channel identifier of the IBC packet.

columns.name: packet_connection
columns.description: The connection identifier of the IBC packet.

columns.name: packet_sequence
columns.description: The sequence number of the IBC packet.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the sender of the IBC transfer.

columns.name: receiver
columns.description: The address of the recipient of the IBC transfer.

columns.name: token_amount
columns.description: The amount of tokens transferred during the IBC transfer.

columns.name: token_path
columns.description: The path of tokens transferred during the IBC transfer.

columns.name: token_alias
columns.description: The alias of the tokens transferred during the IBC transfer.

columns.name: memo
columns.description: A memo or comment associated with the IBC transfer.

columns.name: token_denom
columns.description: The denomination of the tokens transferred during the IBC transfer.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the IBC transfer data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: evmos_ibc_transfer_delays
tables.description: This table tracks transfer delays in the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into the time it takes for transactions to be confirmed across different blockchains. By analyzing these delays, users can better understand the performance of the network and identify potential areas for improvement.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for the transaction.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block where the transaction was initially included.

columns.name: ack_block_height
columns.description: The height of the block where the transaction was acknowledged or confirmed.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the sender who initiated the transaction.

columns.name: tx_delay
columns.description: The time difference between the transaction being included in a block and its acknowledgement.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block where the transaction was initially included.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: evmos_message_event_attributes
tables.description: This table provides detailed information about message events from various blockchains in the Cosmos ecosystem, offering insights into transaction activity and network behavior.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the message event was recorded.

columns.name: chain_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the blockchain on which the message event occurred.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the transaction in which the message event occurred.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within which the event was recorded.

columns.name: event_index
columns.description: The index of the event within the message.

columns.name: event_type
columns.description: The type of event that occurred.

columns.name: attribute_key
columns.description: The key associated with an attribute of the message event.

columns.name: attribute_value
columns.description: The value associated with an attribute of the message event.

columns.name: attribute_index
columns.description: The index of the attribute within the message event.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the message event data was ingested into the database.

tables.name: evmos_message_types_transactions
tables.description: This table provides a detailed overview of transactions within the Cosmos ecosystem, including the sender, message type, and timestamp. It allows for the analysis of various transaction types and their occurrence over time.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transaction was included.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the block was created.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the transaction.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the account that sent the transaction.

columns.name: message_type
columns.description: The type of message being sent in the transaction.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the transaction data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: evmos_redelegate
tables.description: This table contains information about redelegations in the Cosmos ecosystem. It lists all redelegations made across different validators, including the source and destination validators, as well as the amount of tokens redelegated.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: Height of the block in which the redelegation transaction occurred.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp of the block in which the redelegation transaction occurred.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: Index of the message within the transaction.

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: source_validator
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: source_moniker
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: destination_validator
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: destination_moniker
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: delegator
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: evmos_amount
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: completion_time
columns.description: Timestamp when the redelegation was completed.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp when the redelegation data was ingested into the database.

tables.name: evmos_sends
tables.description: This table tracks transactions sent across the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into blockchain activity and token movements. It captures key details from block data and transaction records.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transaction was included, serving as a unique identifier for the block.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block containing the transaction was created, indicating the time of the transaction.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: A unique identifier assigned to the transaction, allowing for tracking and verification of the transaction's integrity.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction, identifying the specific message sent in the transaction.

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: The action or instruction taken within the transaction, describing the type of action performed.

columns.name: sender
columns.description: The address of the account that initiated the transaction, identifying the sender of the tokens.

columns.name: recipient
columns.description: The address of the account that received the tokens in the transaction, identifying the recipient.

columns.name: tokens_amount
columns.description: The quantity of tokens transferred during the transaction, specifying the amount of tokens moved.

columns.name: tokens_denom
columns.description: The denomination of the tokens transferred, indicating the type of token (e.g., ATOM, BNB, etc.).

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the system, indicating the time of data capture.

tables.name: evmos_transactions
tables.description: Cosmos Ecosystem Blockchain Transactions. This table contains information about all transactions occurring across various chains in the Cosmos ecosystem.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The block height at which the transaction was processed.

columns.name: chain_id
columns.description: The ID of the blockchain on which the transaction occurred.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: A unique identifier for the transaction.

columns.name: tx_info
columns.description: Additional information about the transaction.

columns.name: tx_log_message
columns.description: A log message related to the transaction.

columns.name: fee
columns.description: The fee paid for the transaction.

columns.name: tx_code
columns.description: The transaction code or result.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction within a block.

columns.name: gas_used
columns.description: The amount of gas used during the transaction.

columns.name: gas_wanted
columns.description: The amount of gas requested for the transaction.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp at which the transaction was ingested.

columns.name: memo
columns.description: A memo or note associated with the transaction.

columns.name: schema_version
columns.description: The version of the schema used to process the transaction.

columns.name: fee_coins
columns.description: The coins used to pay the transaction fee.

columns.name: fee_granter
columns.description: The account that granted the transaction fee.

columns.name: fee_payer
columns.description: The account that paid the transaction fee.

columns.name: gas_limit
columns.description: The maximum amount of gas the transaction was allowed to use.

columns.name: single_sign_mode
columns.description: Whether the transaction was processed in single sign mode.

columns.name: multi_sign_json
columns.description: JSON data related to multi- sign transactions.

columns.name: timeout_height
columns.description: The block height at which the transaction was timed out.

tables.name: evmos_undelegate
tables.description: This table provides a detailed view of undelegation events on Cosmos chain, offering insights into validator redelegation and token movement.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block where the undelegation event occurred.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block where the undelegation event occurred.

columns.name: tx_id

columns.name: message_index

columns.name: nth_action

columns.name: validator

tables.name: evmos_validators
tables.description: This table lists the active and inactive validators in the Cosmos ecosystem, providing essential information for validators and users to make informed decisions.

columns.name: account_address
columns.description: The address of the validator, which is used for account management and custody.

columns.name: operator_address
columns.description: The address associated with the validator's operator.

columns.name: consensus_pubkey
columns.description: The public key used by the validator for consensus and vote casting.

columns.name: status
columns.description: The current status of the validator, including active, unbonding, or jailed.

columns.name: moniker
columns.description: The human- readable name or identifier for the validator.

columns.name: identity
columns.description: The identity key of the validator, used for key management and verification.

columns.name: rate
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: max_rate
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: min_self_delegation
columns.description: The minimum amount of tokens that validators must self-delegate.

columns.name: Network
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: Snapshot_date
columns.description: No description available

columns.name: proposer_hashed_address
columns.description: No description available

tables.name: evmos_voting
tables.description: This table represents the voting data from the Cosmos ecosystem, where voters cast their votes for proposals.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block where the vote was recorded.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block where the vote was recorded.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: The ID of the transaction where the vote was recorded.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction where the vote was recorded.

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: The nth action within the message where the vote was recorded.

columns.name: voter
columns.description: The account address that cast the vote.

columns.name: proposal_id
columns.description: The ID of the proposal that was voted on.

columns.name: proposal_option
columns.description: The option that the voter chose for the proposal.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: evmos_withdraw_rewards
tables.description: This table contains information about validator rewards withdrawal events on the Cosmos ecosystem. It provides details about the block and transaction context, as well as the validator and recipient involved in the withdrawal.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the withdrawal event occurred.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block in which the withdrawal event occurred.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the transaction that initiated the withdrawal.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message that triggered the withdrawal event within the transaction.

columns.name: nth_action
columns.description: The specific action taken in the withdrawal event (e.g., withdrawing rewards).

columns.name: validator
columns.description: The validator who initiated the withdrawal.

columns.name: moniker
columns.description: The moniker of the validator who initiated the withdrawal.

columns.name: receiver
columns.description: The account that received the withdrawn rewards.

columns.name: token_amount
columns.description: The amount of tokens withdrawn from the validator's account.

columns.name: token_amount_in_usdc
columns.description: The amount of the withdrawn tokens converted to USDC.

columns.name: token_denom
columns.description: The denomination of the withdrawn tokens (e.g., ATOM, LUNA).

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the withdrawal event was ingested into the datasource.
